name: Tyrion Lannister
description: Tyrion Lannister is the youngest child of Lord Tywin Lannister and Lady Joanna Lannister, who died giving birth to him. Born with dwarfism, Tyrion has faced scorn and mockery throughout his life, often using his sharp wit and intellect as both defense and weapon. Despite his family's disdain, he possesses a keen political mind and a surprisingly strong moral compass. Unlike many in Westeros, Tyrion strives to protect the realm and those who cannot defend themselves, even when it means opposing his own family's interests. His journey is marked by his resilience in the face of prejudice and his unwavering commitment to justice and knowledge.
memorableMoments: Slapping Prince Joffrey across the face for his disrespectful behavior.
Leading the defense of King's Landing during the Battle of Blackwater.
His trial speech where he declares, 'I wish I was the monster you think I am.'

name: Daenerys Targaryen
description:
Whether Daenerys will be remembered as a legendary savior or a formidable conqueror, her impact on Westeros is undeniable. From the start, she has been portrayed as the destined ruler of the Iron Throne, with a narrative that runs parallel to events in King's Landing. Her journey includes pivotal moments like reviving dragons, which reintroduced magic into the world.

Her ultimate role in this saga remains uncertain, but her influence on the unfolding story is undeniable. Daenerys Targaryen stands as one of the key figures shaping the series' outcome.
memorableMoments: When she emerged from Khal Drogo's funeral pyre, standing bare and accompanied by three newborn dragons.
Her commanding presence that led to victory over the Unsullied with just a single command: "Dracarys."
The first time she soared on Drogon, escaping an attack in Meereen.

name: Jon Snow
description:
Jon Snow stands out as one of Game of Thrones' most compelling characters, embodying classic heroism with his unwavering honor, kindness, intelligence, persistence, and selflessness. Time and again, he prioritizes duty over personal desires, demonstrating true leadership.

In a tragic twist, Jon is killed in a mutiny by men he once commanded. His allies resort to magic in desperation to bring him back, underscoring his importance as both a good man and their leader.

Beyond his role in the Night’s Watch, Jon's mysterious parentage adds depth to his character. Known initially as Ned Stark's illegitimate son, Jon has shown little interest in claiming the Iron Throne. However, should he discover a legitimate claim to it, along with the support of the North as "King in the North," it could lead to fascinating developments, especially when encountering Daenerys and her dragons.
memorableMoments: Discovering his white direwolf pup, Ghost, and feeling an instant connection.
Choosing to remain Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch over being legitimized as a Stark.
Being resurrected by Melisandre in Season 6, surprising everyone who believed him dead.

name: Cersei Lannister
description:
Cersei Lannister is one of Game of Thrones' most compelling and enigmatic figures. Her character blends a ruthless ambition with deep flaws and cunning intelligence. As a woman navigating the treacherous political landscape, she strives for equality in a male-dominated world. Her mantra, "when you play the game of thrones, you win or you die," has guided her actions, earning both fear and respect as she endures when more honorable figures fall.

Despite committing terrible acts and spiraling into madness, Cersei's determination to ascend the political ladder is undeniable. Her resilience in a hostile world makes her an unforgettable character in Westeros.
memorableMoments: The shocking moment Bran witnesses Cersei engaging in incest with her brother.
The infamous Walk of Shame that remains etched in memory for both fans and Cersei herself.
Despite losing much, Cersei achieves a bittersweet triumph when she finally claims the Iron Throne as queen.

name: Arya Stark
description:
Arya Stark’s journey through Game of Thrones is marked by resilience and adaptability. Despite being one of the series' least powerful principal characters, she demonstrates remarkable strength and resourcefulness. Arya has faced numerous challenges, from periods where her character development seemed to stall, to becoming a formidable survivor in Westeros.

Her ability to reinvent herself — as a water dancer, under her nickname Arry, or as a blind assassin named "No One" — highlights her versatility. Among her most compelling story arcs is her travels with the Hound, which stands out as one of the series' finest moments.
memorableMoments: Arya's initiation into killing is a pivotal moment for her character, famously instructing to 'stick him with the pointy end.'
Her rare laughter at Sansa’s departure from the Eyrie before Arya’s arrival underscores her unique perspective.
Each name crossed off her list of targets signifies her quest for vengeance, culminating in the unforgettable and satisfying death of Walder Frey.

name: Jaime Lannister
description:
Infamously known as the Kingslayer, Jaime Lannister's early actions included betraying his oath by assassinating King Aerys II. Once considered one of Westeros' greatest swordsmen, Jaime’s complex journey reveals layers beyond his initial villainous persona.

His deep, albeit controversial, love for his twin sister Cersei and a unique bond with his brother Tyrion add depth to his character. Key events — the loss of his right hand, which humbles him; the death of his father Tywin Lannister; and the tragic losses of his children — all contribute to Jaime's evolution.

His relationships with Brienne of Tarth and Bronn further illustrate his multifaceted nature, moving beyond his 'Prince Charming from Shrek' nickname. Though not completely redeemed, he is no longer the irredeemable figure he once appeared to be.
memorableMoments: His decision to push Bran Stark out a window to protect Cersei marks a turning point: 'The things we do for love.'
The loss of his sword hand in Season 3 after being captured by Locke.
Choosing loyalty over personal safety, Jaime's strategic takeover of Riverrun during its siege is pivotal.

name: Eddard Stark
description:
Eddard Stark's role in Game of Thrones is foundational, setting the tone with his unwavering commitment to honor, loyalty, and justice. His principles profoundly influence his children, many of whom become pivotal figures in Westeros' political landscape.

Ned’s tragic execution early in the series underscores a critical theme: sometimes, honor can be perilous. His legacy continues to echo throughout the story, shaping characters’ actions long after his death and serving as both a heroic archetype and a cautionary tale about the complexities of power and morality.
memorableMoments: Ned imparts a crucial lesson on honor at the series' start: 'The man who carries the sentence swings the sword.'
Ignoring advice to navigate court politics carefully, he confronts Cersei Lannister about her children's legitimacy.
His shocking execution in Season 1’s penultimate episode marks one of television's most unexpected twists.

name: Tywin Lannister
description:
As one of Game of Thrones' most formidable figures, Tywin Lannister plays a pivotal role in shaping Westeros' political landscape. His influence is evident from the sacking of King's Landing during Robert's Rebellion to his strategic union with the crown, laying the groundwork for major plot developments throughout the series.

Charles Dance’s portrayal captures Tywin's commanding presence and unnerving authority, leaving an indelible impression on both characters and audience alike. He drives significant character development among those around him — challenging Jaime Lannister to prove himself as his true heir, compelling Cersei Lannister to prioritize her family above all else, and constantly reminding Tyrion of his perceived inadequacies.
memorableMoments: At Harrenhal, Tywin appoints a girl disguised as a boy as his cupbearer, unknowingly choosing Arya Stark.
In an act that irreparably damages their relationship, he arranges for Tyrion to stand trial for Joffrey's murder.
Despite his stature and power, Tywin meets an ironic end when he is murdered by his son Jaime while in the privy.

name: Varys "The Spider"
description:
Known as the Master of Whisperers, Varys plays a crucial role in Game of Thrones' intricate web of politics and intrigue. His network of informants, affectionately termed his 'little birds,' provides him with vital secrets that make him one of Westeros' most influential power players.

Varys often finds himself competing with Littlefinger as the primary architect behind many secretive manipulations aimed at achieving larger goals. He is instrumental in guiding Daenerys Targaryen on her path to power and orchestrating Tyrion Lannister’s escape from execution to align with her mission of restoring the Targaryens, all under the guise of serving 'the good of the realm.' Despite his calm demeanor, Varys remains an enigmatic figure whose true motives are perpetually shrouded in mystery.
memorableMoments: Arya Stark eavesdrops on a conversation between Varys and Illyrio Mopatis in Season 1, revealing their plans to resurrect the Targaryen dynasty.
Varys's decision to become a eunuch, following an encounter with a sorcerer who castrated him as part of a spell, marks a defining moment in his life.
In alignment with his longstanding strategy, Varys allies himself with Daenerys Targaryen and sails with her to reclaim Westeros.

name: Catelyn Stark
description:
Catelyn Stark embodies much more than simply being the matriarch of House Stark. As the Lady of Winterfell, her influence extends deeply over her husband and children, playing a pivotal role in the unfolding saga of Game of Thrones.

Her resilience is profoundly tested as she witnesses her family torn apart by tragic events, making her one of Westeros' most formidable and steadfast figures. Her descent into despair culminates tragically at The Red Wedding, marking it as one of the series' most heart-wrenching moments.
memorableMoments: Defying orders, Catelyn captures Tyrion Lannister and takes him to the Vale for trial, accusing him of Jon Arryn's murder.
In a desperate bid to ensure her daughters' safety, she decides to release Jaime Lannister, Robb Stark’s prisoner.
It is through Catelyn that we experience the harrowing realization and subsequent horror of the Red Wedding's betrayal.

name: Sansa Stark
description:
Initially perceived as the least likable member of the Stark family, Sansa's journey in Game of Thrones is transformative. Unlike her sister Arya, she yearned for a life filled with luxury and power, aspiring to be Queen. However, reality in Westeros taught her harsh lessons, through immense loss and suffering.

Sansa’s resilience becomes evident as she adapts and endures, learning to navigate the brutal world around her. She begins to master 'The Game' by leveraging Littlefinger's interest in her and ultimately orchestrates a well-deserved revenge on Ramsay Bolton, showcasing her growth from naivety to strategic acumen.
memorableMoments: Unaware of the dangers surrounding her, Sansa inadvertently betrays her father Ned Stark to Cersei Lannister in Season 1, leading to his capture and execution.
Disguised as 'Alayne,' she boldly reveals her true identity to the lords of the Vale, reclaiming her power.
After enduring Ramsay Bolton's horrific abuses, Sansa exacts revenge by having him fed to his own dogs.

name: Davos Seaworth
description:
In the ruthless world of Game of Thrones, few characters remain consistently likable and genuine without facing dire consequences. Davos Seaworth is a notable exception, though he has not been spared from sorrow and loss. Liam Cunningham's portrayal imbues Davos with a warmth and authenticity that adds humanity to the series' complex web of political intrigue and supernatural threats.

Davos, originally a smuggler who becomes an advisor to kings, serves as the moral compass for the show. This humble man is guided by a strong personal code, recognizing that what might be prudent isn’t always morally correct. He tirelessly advocates for justice and self-belief among characters often consumed by ambition.

Whether encouraging those around him or making heartfelt pleas when all else fails, Davos continually demonstrates his commitment to sacrificing for the greater good—a truly regal pursuit beyond any throne claim.
memorableMoments: As Stannis Baratheon's Hand of the King, Davos leads the Baratheon fleet into the pivotal Battle of Blackwater.
Because of Shireen’s influence on him, he becomes the one to deliver the Night's Watch’s urgent request for reinforcements to Stannis.
His crucial testimony in Season 6 secures Jon and Sansa support from Lady Mormont.

name: Brienne of Tarth
description:
In a world where warrior women are rare, Brienne of Tarth stands out as an extraordinary figure. Despite being ridiculed for her masculine appearance and unconventional femininity, she remains steadfast in her commitment to chivalry and honor. After failing to protect Renly Baratheon, who was one of the few to believe in her, she finds herself allied with Jaime Lannister—her polar opposite. Yet, against all odds, they form a unique bond that transcends their loyalties and Houses, creating one of the series' most memorable pairings.

On the battlefield, Brienne's formidable strength and mastery of Oathkeeper make her an unstoppable force, having defeated numerous foes and triumphed over the Hound in a brutal confrontation. As both unwaveringly loyal and impressively powerful, Brienne is an unforgettable character who garners admiration and support from viewers.
memorableMoments: Her quest to become a knight on Renly's Kingsguard earns her our enduring respect.
Jaime Lannister emerges as one of her most significant companions, highlighted by their iconic bath scene.
She brings the tale of 'The Bear and the Maiden Fair' to life with her battle against a bear at Harrenhal.

name: Petyr Baelish "Littlefinger"
description:
Lord Petyr Baelish, known as Littlefinger, masterminded the conspiracy that set the events of Game of Thrones into motion. By orchestrating Jon Arryn's death—Ned Stark's close ally—he maneuvered his way into power in King’s Landing. The former Master of Coin, now Lord Protector of the Eyrie and the Vale of Arryn, is renowned for his cunning and strategic mind. His web of secrets and plots rivals that of Varys, making him a central figure in Westeros' political intrigues.

Littlefinger's actions are driven by an overarching scheme to ascend through the chaos, aiming for power at all costs. Despite his notorious reputation for betrayal, his unreturned love for Catelyn and later her daughter Sansa adds a layer of vulnerability to his otherwise deceitful persona.
memorableMoments: Littlefinger betrays Ned Stark in Season 1, setting off a chain of events leading to the elder Stark's demise with the ominous line: 'I did warn you not to trust me.'
Demonstrating his affection for Sansa, he rescues her and smuggles her out of King’s Landing.
His timely arrival with the Vale's forces at the Battle of the Bastards, orchestrated by Sansa, turns the tide in a crucial moment.

name: Joffrey Baratheon
description:
Joffrey Baratheon, portrayed by Jack Gleeson, is often remembered as one of Game of Thrones' most despised characters. His tenure on the Iron Throne saw him transform from a spoiled young prince into a sadistic and self-righteous tyrant. This gradual descent was marked by cruelty and tyranny, making his reign feel like an inevitable yet horrifying train wreck.

Joffrey's role in destabilizing Westeros is significant; he was directly responsible for key events such as the execution of Ned Stark—deciding that the 'traitor' should be executed instead of given a chance at redemption. His erratic behavior and indifference to his people’s welfare forced others around him, including Tywin, Tyrion, Cersei, and Sansa, to adapt and rise to new challenges to either mitigate the chaos he caused or simply survive under his rule.

Despite being widely disliked, Joffrey's impact on the series is undeniable. His actions set off a chain of events that reshaped the political landscape of Westeros, making him a catalyst for change throughout the story.
memorableMoments: The audience’s disdain begins when he falsely accuses Arya and her direwolf Nymeria of attacking him, leading to the death of Mycah and his own direwolf Lady.
His order for Ned Stark's execution cements his place as one of the most hated characters in the series.
A memorable scene is Joffrey's murder on his wedding day, marked by the vivid image of his face turning purple.

name: Bran Stark
description:
From early in Game of Thrones' narrative, Bran Stark emerges as one of its most pivotal characters. His journey sets off critical events that drive much of the series' drama, and his unique abilities provide insight into the mystical aspects of this world.

Bran's quest to understand his powers leads him on a path toward the Three-Eyed Raven. This journey is marked by significant moments where he uncovers secrets from both the past and present, hinting at his future importance in the unfolding story.
memorableMoments: Demonstrating an early lesson of always listening to his mother, Bran unintentionally witnesses the Lannister twins in a compromising position, resulting in him being pushed out a window.
His latent magical abilities begin to surface as he connects with and eventually meets the Three-Eyed Raven.
In one of the series' pivotal moments, using his newfound powers, Bran inadvertently makes contact with the Night King.

name: Sandor Clegane "The Hound"
description: Despite his fearsome reputation as a dangerous fighter, Sandor 'The Hound' Clegane's journey from the shadows of his infamous brother Gregor to finding redemption captivates audiences. Initially serving as Joffrey Baratheon's guard, Sandor develops an unexpected empathy for those perceived as weak or underdog—qualities that manifest through his interactions with Sansa and Arya Stark. His transformation is a compelling narrative arc, skillfully portrayed by Rory McCann, who brings depth to the character's struggle between darkness and redemption.
memorableMoments: The audience glimpses Sandor’s softer side when he offers brusque comfort to Sansa after Joffrey assaults her in Season 1’s finale.
His simple but memorable request for 'two chickens' showcases his no-nonsense personality.
His unexpected return in Season 6 is both surprising and heartwarming, marking one of the show's most impactful moments.

name: Melisandre
description: As a shadowbinder and priestess to Stannis Baratheon, Melisandre's powerful magic and unwavering faith in identifying the prophesied messiah significantly impact Westeros. Her actions—ranging from summoning a shadow demon to assassinate Renly Baratheon to attempting to resurrect Jon Snow—are driven by her belief in fulfilling ancient prophecies. Her journey is marked by profound realizations as she confronts the limitations and misinterpretations of her beliefs.
memorableMoments: Melisandre's creation of a shadow demon to kill Renly Baratheon stands out as one of her most dramatic acts.
In a revealing moment, she sheds her magical disguise, unveiling herself as an ancient and weary woman.
Her pivotal role in resurrecting Jon Snow in Season 6 is hailed as one of the series' most memorable moments.

name: Theon Greyjoy
description: Raised as a ward under Ned Stark after his father's unsuccessful uprising, Theon Greyjoy always felt like an outsider in the Stark household. Despite being considered part of the family, he struggled with complex emotions toward the Starks. His deep-seated resentment and longing to claim his rightful place as the heir of the Iron Islands ultimately led him down a path of betrayal against those who raised him. Captured and brutally tortured by Ramsay Bolton following a failed rebellion, Theon was reduced to a broken individual known only as 'Reek.' Despite later being presented with an opportunity for redemption through aiding Sansa Stark's escape from Ramsay, he faltered. Now back with his sister Yara Greyjoy, it remains uncertain whether Theon can reclaim any sense of his former self and if he truly finds redemption in their quest to claim the Iron Throne.
memorableMoments: Theon incurs the audience’s wrath when he betrays the Starks by seizing control over Winterfell.
He garners sympathy as he endures capture and relentless torment at Ramsay Bolton's hands for several seasons.
His journey toward redemption begins as he assists Sansa Stark in escaping from Ramsay’s cruelty.

name: Margaery Tyrell
description: Margaery Tyrell is one of Game of Thrones' most captivating characters, known for her charm and strategic acumen. Her complexity lies in her ability to defy simple categorization; she oscillates between genuine kindness and calculated manipulation. Ambitious by nature and guided by the cunning wisdom of her grandmother Olenna, Margaery skillfully navigated the treacherous political landscape of King’s Landing. While some may question whether her concern for the less fortunate was sincere or merely a tactic to gain favor, her interactions with Tommen suggest a deeper layer of compassion, though always aligned with her overarching goals. Ultimately, Margaery's ability to devise and implement various strategies kept audiences engaged as she maneuvered through the challenges before her.
memorableMoments: Margaery demonstrates her political acumen by asserting herself not merely as a 'queen,' but as 'the queen.'
Her rivalry with Cersei takes a dramatic turn when she finds herself atoning for her actions under the High Sparrow's influence.
She remains endearing to fans for her thoughtful gesture of gifting Tommen Ser Pounce.

name: Bronn
description: Bronn stands out among Game of Thrones characters as an embodiment of integrity and straightforwardness, contrasting sharply with the often duplicitous nobility. As one of the few commoners to play a significant role in Westeros’ political intrigues, his unvarnished honesty offers a refreshing change from the usual scheming. Bronn’s journey begins as a sellsword who earns Tyrion Lannister's trust by defending him at the Eyrie, forming an enduring friendship. Later, he becomes Jaime Lannister's trusted companion and training partner, assisting the knight in adapting to life without his sword hand.
memorableMoments: Bronn solidifies his bond with Tyrion by fighting for him at the Eyrie.
He becomes a vital ally to Jaime Lannister, helping the knight train in swordsmanship despite being handless.
Throughout the series, Bronn's presence is consistently delightful due to Flynn’s adept comedic timing.

name: Stannis Baratheon
description: A complex figure in Game of Thrones, Stannis Baratheon is both revered and reviled. As King Robert’s younger brother, he was arguably the rightful heir to the throne, embodying a sense of duty and diligence that could have made him an effective ruler. However, his reign was overshadowed by his allegiance to Melisandre, a Red Priestess whose influence led Stannis into morally questionable actions under the guise of fulfilling prophecies through Lord of Light blood magic. While he often seemed like the lesser evil amid the chaos of power struggles in Westeros, there were moments when his decisions veered into cruelty, such as the harrowing decision to sacrifice his daughter.
memorableMoments: Succumbing to Melisandre’s influence, Stannis consummates their relationship on the Painted Table, resulting in her impregnation with a shadow creature.
In a poignant moment, Stannis recounts to Shireen why he chose to keep her alive, ending with a reluctant embrace that underscores his internal conflict.
The dramatic beheading by Brienne leaves viewers questioning his fate, only for it to be revealed that he did not survive the encounter.

name: Jorah Mormont
description: Jorah Mormont is a multifaceted character in Game of Thrones, embodying the roles of exile, spy, servant, and soldier. Initially introduced as Varys’s spy masquerading as Daenerys Targaryen's mentor, Jorah quickly develops a deep admiration—and ultimately love—for Khaleesi. Despite his affection, Daenerys does not reciprocate his feelings, leading to her banishing him once he is caught in deceitful activities. Driven by the desire for redemption, Jorah goes to great lengths to prove himself worthy of Dany's trust. He becomes a complex figure—loyal and wise yet entangled in betrayal against the woman he loves. Adding to his tragic arc, Jorah contracts greyscale, an incurable disease that marks him for death.
memorableMoments: Despite beginning as Varys's spy, Jorah demonstrates true loyalty to Daenerys by thwarting an assassination attempt on her life.
His banishment in Season 4 marks a crucial turning point for Jorah’s character development and quest for redemption.
In Season 5, while traveling with Tyrion Lannister, Jorah contracts greyscale, signaling the onset of his tragic downfall.

name: Olenna Tyrell
description: Known as the 'Queen of Thorns,' Olenna Tyrell is renowned for her sharp wit and no-nonsense demeanor. As the de facto leader of House Tyrell, she expertly maneuvers behind the scenes to advance the family's interests, often outsmarting those around her with her strategic acumen and incisive commentary. Olenna’s influence extends far beyond quiet conversations in garden paths or dining rooms; her skillfully chosen words can be as impactful as any military confrontation. She stands out through her exchanges with formidable figures like Tywin Lannister, Cersei Lannister, and the High Sparrow, showcasing her ability to leverage her economic power to assert dominance.
memorableMoments: From their first encounter, Olenna immediately sets herself apart with candid and impactful remarks, becoming an integral part of Westeros's narrative.
Her verbal sparring match with Tywin Lannister stands out as a highlight, emphasizing her formidable presence and intelligence.
Despite the demise of many Tyrells, Olenna remains undeterred. Her alliance with Ellaria Sand and the Sand Snakes signals thrilling schemes for retribution.

name: Ramsay Bolton
description: Ramsay Bolton epitomizes malevolence, embodying cruelty and sadism. His intelligence is wielded for nefarious purposes, making him one of the most chilling antagonists in Game of Thrones. The show delves into his complexity by examining his tumultuous relationship with his father and hinting at a capacity for love through his interactions with Myranda. Despite these layers, Ramsay remains a stark portrayal of human depravity, shaped by his harsh environment into a figure of terror. Iwan Rheon's performance adds depth to Ramsay, transforming him from a one-dimensional villain into a deeply unsettling character rooted in reality.
memorableMoments: Ramsay's cruel taunting of Theon Greyjoy with a sausage is a stark display of his sadistic nature.
His elevation to legitimate heir on the hills near Winterfell marks a significant power shift.
In 'The Battle of the Bastards,' Ramsay nearly topples Jon Snow’s army, showcasing his formidable military prowess.

name: Roose Bolton
description: Roose Bolton stands out among House Stark's betrayers as both cunning and somewhat pragmatic. As the mastermind behind the infamous Red Wedding, Roose delivered a chilling line with his phrase, ‘The Lannisters send their regards,’ while killing Robb Stark. He claimed Winterfell and the title of Warden of the North for himself but ultimately fell prey to his own son, Ramsay’s, madness. Though a significant antagonist in the series, Roose is portrayed more as an opportunist than pure evil. His complex relationship with Ramsay—who he initially turned a blind eye towards despite the boy's evident cruelty—is central to his character arc.
memorableMoments: The unforgettable line ‘The Lannisters send their regards’ was delivered by Roose as he plunged a knife into Robb Stark’s heart during the Red Wedding.
In the books, Roose is known for leeching himself, earning him the moniker 'Leech Lord.'
Despite Ramsay being his bastard son, Roose legitimized him in an emotionally charged moment.

name: Robb Stark
description: The eldest son of Ned Stark, Robb was poised to avenge his father's betrayal and murder. However, in the treacherous world of Westeros, his quest for redemption ended abruptly with the massacre at the Red Wedding. Known for his honor, Robb’s downfall began when he executed Lord Karstark for war crimes, leading to dissent among his followers that culminated in mutiny. Despite his noble intentions and leadership as 'King in the North,' it was ultimately his own oath-breaking that led to his tragic demise.
memorableMoments: In a rare tender moment from the series premiere, Robb discovers direwolf pups with his siblings and names his Grey Wind.
He is proudly hailed as the ‘King in the North’ by the lords who once pledged loyalty to his father, alongside Theon Greyjoy’s proclamation.
During the Red Wedding, Robb is paralyzed by shock and grief at the sight of his murdered wife Talisa, unable to fight back or flee.

name: Oberyn Martell
description: Princely and passionate, Oberyn Martell arrives in King’s Landing with a burning resentment towards Tywin Lannister for the death of his sister Elia during the sacking of King’s Landing. His introduction marks the first formal glimpse into Dorne's culture; he is both logical and fervent, restrained yet perilous. Though his time on screen was brief, Oberyn became iconic for his brave but ill-fated defense of Tyrion Lannister in a trial by combat against Ser Gregor Clegane.
memorableMoments: "I will be your champion." Oberyn agrees to fight Ser Gregor for an all-but condemned Tyrion.
The Red Viper kicked off his visit to King's Landing with quite the memorable orgy.
The Mountain vs. The Viper! So close, but then....POP!

name: Walder Frey
description: A detestable lord of the Riverlands, Walder Frey is despised for his craven nature and petty scheming. Despite this, he becomes pivotal in one of the series' most shocking events: the Red Wedding. Known for his numerous marriages and progeny, whose names even he barely remembers, Frey betrays Robb Stark by joining forces with the Lannisters after being slighted by a broken marriage promise.
memorableMoments: During the Red Wedding, Catelyn Stark threatens Walder’s wife, but her reassurance of finding another wife seals the Starks' fate.
The morning after the massacre, he raises a toast to Roose Bolton with the chilling words, "Here's to the young wolf!" followed by a haunting howl.
Arya Stark's grim retribution: discovering his sons baked into a meat pie.

name: Samwell Tarly
description: Despite being banished to the Wall by his overzealous father, Samwell Tarly finds solace and purpose among the Night's Watch. Known for his gentle spirit and love of books, he becomes an invaluable asset at Castle Black, taking on the role of scholar among warriors. As Jon Snow’s best friend, Sam endures numerous trials, from battles with White Walkers to diplomatic missions across Westeros, all while pursuing knowledge in places like Oldtown.
memorableMoments: In a daring confrontation, Sam disintegrates a formidable White Walker by stabbing it in the back with Dragonglass.
He advocates for Jon Snow’s leadership, nominating him as Lord Commander despite his youth: 'He may be young, but he's the commander we turned to when the night was darkest.'
Breaking his vows of celibacy, Sam and Gilly finally consummate their relationship, marking a significant personal milestone.

name: Ygritte
description: A fierce and resourceful Wildling warrior, Ygritte captivates Jon Snow with her intelligence and boldness during his time undercover within Mance Rayder's Free Folk army. Their complex relationship creates tension when Jon’s true allegiance as a member of the Night’s Watch is revealed. Ygritte remains unforgettable for her fiery spirit, deep connection with Jon, and poignant final moments at Castle Black.
memorableMoments: Ygritte and Jon share intimate moments in the secluded hot springs cave, highlighting their unexpected bond.
Despite her love for him, Ygritte reluctantly shoots three arrows at an unwilling Jon as he tries to return to his Night’s Watch duties.
In her last breaths during a fierce battle, she whispers to Jon, 'You know nothing, Jon Snow…', echoing one of the series' most iconic lines and underscoring their complicated relationship.

name: The Night King
description: Created by the Children of the Forest as a formidable protector against the First Men, The Night King emerges as the chilling leader of the White Walkers and their undead army. His mysterious powers, including his ability to create White Walkers with a touch, present an unprecedented threat that eclipses all other conflicts in Westeros. The Night King's presence ushers in a long-anticipated winter, embodying the ultimate evil against which humanity must unite.
memorableMoments: In a chilling act of power, The Night King touches Craster’s infant son, initiating his transformation into a White Walker.
He confronts Jon Snow with an intense staredown at Hardhome, a pivotal moment underscoring his relentless pursuit.
During an encounter within Bran’s vision, The Night King marks the psychic Stark by grasping his arm, hinting at deeper plans and connections.

name: Ser Gregor Clegane
description: Known as 'The Mountain' due to his immense size and strength, Ser Gregor Clegane is notorious across Westeros for his brutality and unwavering loyalty to House Lannister. His menacing presence is often a harbinger of violence and despair, whether through his merciless acts at Harrenhal or his role in executing Cersei’s ruthless commands. Perhaps most infamous for the gruesome beheading of Oberyn Martell, Gregor epitomizes a relentless force of destruction.
memorableMoments: Following his notorious display of petulance by decapitating his own horse, Gregor engages in a fierce duel with his brother Sandor, which is abruptly ended by King Robert.
In a brutal showdown at the Red Wedding, he mercilessly defeats Oberyn Martell by crushing the 'Viper’s' face, demonstrating his fearsome combat prowess.

name: Robert Baratheon
description: A central figure in the early episodes of 'Game of Thrones,' King Robert plays a pivotal role in Westeros’s history. As an old friend of Eddard Stark, he spearheaded the rebellion against the tyrannical Mad King Aerys II, ultimately leading to Robert's ascent to the throne after marrying Lyanna Stark. However, his rule is marked by neglect and indulgence, which contributes significantly to the political turmoil that defines the series.
memorableMoments: In a poignant moment at Winterfell’s Stark crypt, Robert mourns beside the statue of his beloved wife, Lyanna, away from the prying eyes of Queen Cersei.
During a rare private exchange with Cersei, he confesses how no amount of power could fill the void left by Lyanna’s death, showcasing his vulnerability and regret.
On his deathbed, Robert entrusts Eddard Stark as 'Lord Regent' and attempts to revoke the assassination orders on Daenerys, highlighting his late efforts to amend past mistakes.

name: Gilly
description: Introduced as one of Craster's daughter-wives in the harsh world north of the Wall, Gilly’s life changes dramatically upon meeting Samwell Tarly. Initially pregnant with Craster’s son, she gives birth to her child amidst turmoil and flees with Sam during a Night’s Watch mutiny after witnessing him slay a White Walker with Dragonglass.
memorableMoments: Recognizing Samwell's ability to glean knowledge from written words, she exclaims he is akin to a wizard.
Amidst danger posed by the Night’s Watch, Gilly provides care for the wounded Sam and becomes his first intimate partner after he intervenes on her behalf.
Defying her fears, Gilly bravely stands up for Sam in front of his disapproving family, revealing his heroic deeds against formidable foes like a Thenn and a White Walker.

name: Tormund Giantsbane
description: A formidable Wildling warrior, Tormund is known for his immense size and large ego. His journey with Jon Snow evolves from bonding over Ygritte to becoming the leader of the Free Folk after Mance Rayder’s execution. He forms a truce with Jon to unite against the White Walkers, surviving key battles like the Battle for the Wall and Hardhome. Now, he shows interest in Lady Brienne.
memorableMoments: An iconic scene features Tormund scaling the Wall with determination using a pickaxe.
At Hardhome, after being labeled a traitor, Tormund decisively defeats the 'Lord of Bones.'
In Season 6, his burgeoning attraction to Brienne adds an intriguing dynamic to their interactions.

name: Grey Worm
description: Once an enslaved warrior-eunuch, Grey Worm becomes one of Daenerys Targaryen’s most trusted advisors and leader of the Unsullied. Known for his stoic demeanor, he surprises fans by developing a deep connection with Missandei. His unwavering loyalty and combat prowess make him indispensable in Dany's forces.
memorableMoments: Despite Daenerys ordering the Unsullied to abandon their slave names, Grey Worm chooses to keep his as a testament to his past and the freedom she granted.
During recovery from injuries in an ambush, he confesses to Missandei that he feared they might never see each other again.

name: Yara Greyjoy
description: After her brothers' tragic deaths during Balon Greyjoy's failed rebellion, Yara steps into a leadership role. Known for her naval prowess and sharp wit, she initially harbors resentment towards Theon but eventually reveals loyalty toward him. Joining forces with Daenerys Targaryen, she seeks to become the rightful ruler of the Iron Isles.
memorableMoments: During their first encounter post-separation, Theon fails to recognize Yara and attempts an awkward advance. Yara allows this moment to play out, using it to humiliate him.
In a daring rescue attempt for Theon at the Dreadfort, she discovers him broken and cowering in his cage, prompting her poignant remark, 'My brother's dead,' before retreating.
At their initial meeting with Daenerys in Meereen, subtle exchanges between Yara and Dany spark intrigue and speculation about potential alliances.

name: Podrick Payne
description: Starting as a humble squire to Tyrion Lannister, Podrick proves his worth through loyalty and bravery. Known for his dry humor and steady presence, he navigates Westeros with an unexpected skillset that endears him to both allies and foes. From crucial rescues in battle to navigating complex social situations, Podrick evolves into a key figure who provides comic relief amidst the show's darker themes.
memorableMoments: During the Battle of the Blackwater, Podrick heroically thwarts Ser Mandon Moore’s assassination attempt on Tyrion with a well-placed spear.

In an amusing encounter at a local brothel, Podrick shares that his 'abilities' were so appreciated that the women declined to charge him, leading to a memorable exchange between him, Tyrion, and Bronn.

name: Meera Reed
description: Introduced as a steadfast companion to her younger brother Jojen and Bran Stark, Meera's primary role is to protect Jojen and guide them northward. Lacking supernatural abilities herself, she relies on strength, resourcefulness, and survival skills to navigate the perils beyond the Wall. Her unwavering loyalty and fierce determination make her an invaluable ally in their quest to meet the Three-Eyed Raven.
memorableMoments: Demonstrating her formidable skills, Meera nearly engages in a playful altercation with Osha over who can skin a rabbit more efficiently.
Outside of the show, Meera has become central to a popular fan theory concerning the Tower of Joy, sparking curiosity and speculation among fans.

name: Shireen Baratheon
description: Shireen Baratheon is portrayed as a poignant symbol of innocence caught in the machinations of power and ambition. As Stannis's daughter, her life was overshadowed by his relentless quest for the Iron Throne. Despite being afflicted with Greyscale, Shireen embodies kindness and intelligence, forging a meaningful friendship with Ser Davos to whom she taught reading. Her tragic end at her father’s hands underscores the devastating cost of his obsession.
memorableMoments: Defying Stannis's orders, Shireen sneaks out to visit her friend Ser Davos in prison, demonstrating her courage and loyalty.
She leaves a lasting impact on Game of Thrones by teaching Davos to read, highlighting her intelligence and kindness.
In one of the show’s most heart-wrenching scenes, Shireen pleads for her parents' help as she burns at the stake, only to face their silence, revealing the depth of Stannis's obsession.

name: Renly Baratheon
description: As the youngest Baratheon brother, Renly emerges as a charismatic yet underappreciated contender for the Iron Throne following his elder brother Robert's death. Known for his charm and liberal views on love, he quickly becomes central in the political turmoil of King’s Landing. His unexpected assassination through dark magic orchestrated by Melisandre introduces one of the series' most memorable supernatural elements. Renly is also notable for bringing significant characters like Brienne of Tarth and Margaery Tyrell into prominence.
memorableMoments: In a defining moment, Loras challenges Renly’s aversion to blood as they witness his own cut bleeding during an intimate encounter.
Displaying his faith in strength and honor, Renly instantly accepts Brienne's offer to serve as one of his personal protectors with the words, 'Done. Rise, Brienne of the Kingsguard.'

name: Jaqen H’ghar
description: An enigmatic figure associated with the Faceless Men, an organization dedicated to anonymity and assassination. His true identity remains shrouded in mystery, possibly serving as a pseudonym for many members. Known for his calm demeanor and cryptic advice, Jaqen introduces Arya Stark to the world of covert operations, teaching her essential skills needed to survive in Westeros. His influence propels Arya on a transformative journey to Braavos, where she learns to become 'no one.'
memorableMoments: When approached by Arya for guidance as an assassin, Jaqen entrusts her with a coin and instructions to travel to Braavos.
After warding off threats in Braavos, he reveals himself to Arya, explaining the importance of becoming 'no one' to achieve true power.
Through his teachings, audiences are introduced to the powerful phrases ‘Valar Morghulis’ (All men must die) and ‘Valar Dohaeris’ (All men must serve).

name: High Sparrow
description: The charismatic leader of the Faith Militant, High Sparrow becomes a formidable force in King's Landing during Seasons 5 and 6. Initially supported by Cersei Lannister to undermine Margaery Tyrell, his influence quickly surpasses her control, leading to widespread chaos throughout the city. While he often presents himself as humble and committed to justice, High Sparrow’s actions reveal a cunning strategist with profound religious fervor. His power struggle with Cersei culminates in dramatic consequences for both their fates.
memorableMoments: In a tense confrontation, Lady Olenna Tyrell demands the release of her grandchildren, only to be firmly rebuffed by High Sparrow: 'You don't give commands here, Lady Olenna.'
The shock and realization on his face just moments before being disintegrated by Cersei’s wildfire attack stand as one of the series’ most iconic scenes.

name: Ellaria Sand
description: Emerging as a formidable and vengeful figure in Dorne, driven by her deep-seated desire to avenge the murder of her lover, Oberyn Martell. Her impassioned cry for justice resonates throughout the region, symbolizing growing dissent against Lannister rule. When Prince Doran declines to retaliate directly, Ellaria orchestrates a coup with her loyal Sand Snakes, seizing control and posing a significant threat to King's Landing. Known for her sharp intelligence and ruthless tactics, she becomes a crucial player in Westeros' intricate power struggle.
memorableMoments: Her heart-wrenching scream upon witnessing Oberyn’s brutal death at the hands of Gregor Clegane epitomizes her quest for vengeance.
In a moment of twisted mercy, Ellaria offers Olenna Tyrell 'her heart's desire': Vengeance on Tyrion Lannister.
Despite limited screen time, Ellaria is poised to play a pivotal role in the downfall of the Lannisters, highlighting her as a key figure in the series' final acts.

name: Daario Naharis
description: Introduced as a formidable and charismatic Second Sons mercenary, Daario quickly captures the attention of Daenerys Targaryen during the swift conquest of Yunkai. Initially inciting jealousy in Jorah Mormont, he swiftly becomes one of Daenerys’ most trusted allies and lovers. His loyalty extends beyond romantic involvement; he stands by her both in political matters and personal trials. Despite their deep connection, like Drogo before him, Daario is a love that Daenerys ultimately must leave behind as she pursues her destiny.
memorableMoments: Demonstrating his unwavering loyalty immediately after interrupting Daenerys’ bath by presenting the heads of his defeated captains on her floor.
Defeating the Champion of Meereen in less than 10 seconds, first incapacitating the horse and then delivering a swift, decisive blow to the champion.
On a rescue mission, Daario humorously addresses the tension with Jorah Mormont by acknowledging that he must indeed be jealous.

name: Loras Tyrell
description: Introduced as the charismatic knight of House Tyrell, Ser Loras is known for his striking appearance and unwavering loyalty. Initially serving under Renly Baratheon, he becomes instrumental in persuading him to claim the throne. His sexuality becomes pivotal when tensions rise with the Lannisters; Cersei's animosity towards Margaery leads to his imprisonment and downfall. Despite facing significant adversity, Ser Loras remains an enduring symbol of both loyalty and personal integrity.
memorableMoments: Persuading Renly Baratheon to pursue the throne by shaving his chest during a private moment, convincing him that he should rule before Robert’s sons or Stannis.
During a tense confrontation with Jaime Lannister, responding sharply: 'And neither will you,' when Jaime dismisses the possibility of marrying Cersei.
Margaery Tyrell's hopes are crushed upon visiting Loras in his prison cell, finding him in a fragile and defeated state due to the Faith Militant’s harsh treatment.

name: Khal Drogo
description: Introduced as a fearsome Dothraki warlord, Khal Drogo forms an unexpected bond with Daenerys Targaryen when they marry under a pact orchestrated by Viserys Targaryen and Illyrio Mopatis. This union transforms into a profound partnership marked by mutual respect and love. Drogo's influence profoundly impacts Daenerys’ ambitions, shifting her focus toward ruling Westeros rather than supporting her brother’s claims. Tragically, Drogo’s life is cut short due to a misjudged healing attempt, leaving Daenerys to navigate the aftermath without him. His legacy endures as a pivotal figure in her journey of empowerment and leadership.
memorableMoments: Demonstrating his dark humor by giving Viserys Targaryen his 'golden crown,' scalding and killing him with melted gold.
Defending Daenerys’ honor from an insolent warrior, dramatically ripping out the man’s tongue through his throat.
In a poignant vision within the House of the Undying, Daenerys envisions Drogo alongside their lost son, Rhaego.

name: Hodor
description: Introduced as a gentle yet simple-minded giant serving House Stark, Hodor is known for his endearing repetition of only one word—his name. His unwavering loyalty makes him an essential member of Bran Stark’s party, and he becomes deeply beloved by viewers. Hodor's tragic death occurs during the Battle of Hardhome when he heroically fulfills a promise to 'Hold the door,' sacrificing himself in the process. This poignant moment reveals the supernatural connection between his past and present self, as influenced by Bran’s time-traveling abilities.
memorableMoments: Despite his gentle nature, Hodor becomes formidable when his body is possessed by Bran Stark, using this power to fight against Night’s Watch mutineers.
It's revealed that Hodor's real name was Wylis before a fateful encounter with Bran resulted in him losing all other memories and words, leaving only 'Hodor.'

His name and condition originate from a traumatic event where Bran, inadvertently visiting his future self, witnesses the young Wylis experiencing a mind-breaking moment—resulting in Bran's exclamation: 'Hold the door.'

name: Shae
description: Shae is introduced as an independent and alluring prostitute who forms a deep connection with Tyrion Lannister following their meeting at the Battle of the Green Fork. This relationship blossoms into love, leading her to accompany him to King's Landing during his tenure as Hand of the King. However, Shae’s position in Tyrion's life becomes increasingly precarious due to his marriage to Sansa Stark and the need to conceal their affair. Ultimately, her testimony at Tyrion’s trial serves as a catalyst for his dramatic departure from Westeros, highlighting themes of love, betrayal, and survival.
memorableMoments: Shae captivates Tyrion with her mysterious demeanor during a truth-telling drinking game with Bronn, leaving him intrigued by her enigmatic nature.
Following the Battle of the Blackwater, she remains unfazed when confronted with the extent of Tyrion's facial scarring, showcasing her acceptance and devotion to him.
During Tyrion’s trial, Shae betrays him by denying their relationship and falsely claiming that Tyrion plotted to kill Joffrey Baratheon, a pivotal moment leading to his downfall.

name: Brynden Tully "The Blackfish"
description: Known as 'The Blackfish,' Brynden Tully is introduced as Catelyn Stark's formidable uncle, characterized by his grizzled and taciturn demeanor. Initially serving as an advisor to Robb Stark, he emerges from the Red Wedding alive and returns in Season 6 with a determination to reclaim Riverrun for House Tully. As one of the few surviving old-timers who remains staunchly opposed to the Lannisters, Brynden ultimately meets his end off-screen during a final stand against their forces, solidifying his legacy as a resilient defender of his house.
memorableMoments: He steps in to replace his nephew Edmure after successfully shooting a flaming arrow at Lord Hoster Tully's funeral—a feat that earns him the respect of those present.
Brynden notably avoids death at the Red Wedding due to a well-timed break outside the hall, showcasing his keen survival instincts.
Before making a final stand against Lannister and Frey forces, he assists Brienne of Tarth in escaping through a secret waterway, demonstrating his loyalty and strategic acumen.

name: Thoros of Myr
description: Introduced as a Red Priest with a distinctive and eccentric appearance, Thoros is known for his flaming sword. Initially tasked with converting King Robert Baratheon to the Lord of Light, he becomes notable for repeatedly resurrecting Beric Dondarrion during the War of the Five Kings. His unique abilities make him an integral figure within the Brotherhood Without Banners. In Season 6, he reappears as the group prepares to confront new threats in the North.
memorableMoments: After Beric is slain by Sandor Clegane (the Hound), Thoros revives him for a sixth time using his mystical powers, showcasing his dedication and prowess as a Red Priest.
He plays a crucial role in explaining to Melisandre how Red Priests can resurrect the dead—a knowledge she later uses on Jon Snow, significantly impacting the series' plot.

name: Jojen Reed
description: Jojen Reed, alongside his sister Meera, joins the Stark cause at the onset of Season 3 as emissaries from the Neck region. Their mission is to escort Bran Stark beyond the Wall for training with the Three-Eyed Raven. As fellow 'Greenseers,' Jojen plays a crucial role in helping Bran comprehend and develop his burgeoning psychic abilities following his paralysis. Despite their fragile appearances, both siblings courageously confront the dark forces threatening Winterfell, ultimately sacrificing themselves to save Bran.
memorableMoments: In a daring act of distraction, Jojen deceives turncoat Karl with the words: 'I saw your body burn. I saw the snow fall and bury your bones.' This ruse is pivotal in their escape from captivity.
Jojen is instrumental in guiding Bran toward his path of magical enlightenment by leading him to the Three-Eyed Raven.

name: Missandei
description: Originally a slave of the Masters of Astapor, Missandei witnesses Daenerys Targaryen’s dramatic dragon-led conquest and becomes an integral member of her inner circle. Her linguistic prowess and steadfast loyalty make her a trusted advisor to Daenerys, who has promised to abolish slavery throughout her realm. Alongside Grey Worm, Missandei forms a significant bond within the Unsullied, characterized by their mutual respect and affection.
memorableMoments: Following Daenerys’ declaration 'Valar Morghulis' ('All men must die'), Missandei adds an essential perspective with her retort 'Valar Dohaeris' ('All men must serve'), highlighting themes of freedom and servitude.
Her first comedic attempt, which she shares with Grey Worm, is humorously critiqued as the worst joke he’s ever heard—an endearing moment that showcases their camaraderie.

name: Beric Dondarrion
description: Beric Dondarrion makes his first appearance in Season 1, initially played by a different actor. He later reappears significantly in Season 3 as the resilient leader of the Brotherhood Without Banners—a neutral faction operating in the Riverlands. Renowned for his repeated resurrections, Beric becomes central to the exploration of supernatural themes related to the Lord of Light's power over life and death. His frequent returns from death inspire Melisandre’s successful resurrection of Jon Snow, highlighting a key plot device within the series.
memorableMoments: One of the most iconic images is Beric wielding a flaming sword during his battle with Sandor Clegane (the Hound), showcasing both his bravery and otherworldly powers.
Despite identifying as a champion for justice, Beric finds himself on Arya Stark’s 'list,' underscoring the complex moral landscape of Westeros.

name: Edmure Tully
description: Edmure Tully, Catelyn Stark’s less formidable brother and the head of House Tully, is initially noted for his ill-fated attempts to shoot a flaming arrow at his father's funeral barge. Remarkably, he survives the infamous Red Wedding—a twist in the series that leaves audiences wondering about his fate. It is only later revealed that Edmure was spared as part of Roose Bolton’s strategic plans during the War of the Five Kings. Despite being perceived as weak-willed and often overshadowed by his uncle Blackfish, Edmure becomes a crucial pawn in Jaime Lannister's scheme to reclaim Riverrun, showcasing how he navigates political machinations in Westeros.
memorableMoments: His desperate attempts with the flaming arrows at his father Hoster Tully’s funeral barge are etched as dramatic moments of failure and foreshadowing.
The poignant image of Edmure being led to his wedding night chamber, just before the Red Wedding turns blood-red, remains one of the series' most shocking reveals.

name: Barristan Selmy
description: Renowned as one of the greatest knights in Westeros, Ser Barristan Selmy is dismissed from his position as a member of the Kingsguard by King Joffrey—under Cersei's influence—due to perceived disloyalty and age. This dismissal propels him westward, where he pledges allegiance to Daenerys Targaryen. In her service, he plays a crucial role in guiding and protecting her, even confronting former allies like Ser Jorah Mormont. Barristan’s narrative bridges the gap between the political intrigue of King's Landing and Daenerys’ rise to power in Essos, marking him as one of the pivotal characters connecting these storylines.
memorableMoments: In a defiant response to his dismissal from the Kingsguard, Barristan proclaims he could dispatch the guards barring his way 'as easily as carving a cake,' underscoring his legendary martial prowess.
He gains Daenerys’ trust and loyalty by heroically defending her against a manticore attack in Astapor, an act that solidifies his role as one of her most trusted advisors.
His death at the hands of the Sons of the Harpy during their ambush is notable for its tragic irony; despite his vast experience, he falls to foes who should have been within his capacity to defeat.

name: Benjen Stark
description: As one of the noble First Rangers of the Night’s Watch, Uncle Benjen serves as a significant figure and inspiration for Jon Snow. His mysterious disappearance during a patrol northward in Season 1 becomes a catalyst for the plotline involving the White Walkers and the Wildling threat. This event propels Jon on an epic journey to uncover the truth about what lies beyond the Wall. Benjen's return to the series as half-zombie, having been saved by the Children of the Forest from being fully turned into a wight, is a pivotal moment that connects past mysteries with present events and highlights his enduring bond with Jon.
memorableMoments: The revelation of Benjen’s fate—his transformation into 'Coldhands'—provides a dramatic twist and explanation for earlier sightings of figures beyond the Wall.
His initial role as an inspiration to Jon underscores the Stark family's deep ties to the Night’s Watch and sets the stage for Jon’s leadership journey.

name: Gendry
description: Introduced during Ned Stark's investigation into Jon Arryn’s death, Gendry is revealed as one of Robert Baratheon's bastards. His journey from King’s Landing to the freedom of the road makes him an integral part of Arya Stark’s escape and adventures beyond the capital. Along the way, Gendry becomes a potential love interest for Arya, creating intriguing possibilities for their future interactions. Gendry's discovery of his true parentage by Melisandre adds layers to his character, hinting at his significance in the larger conflict for the Iron Throne. His mysterious absence from Season 4, humorously addressed by actor Joe Dempsie’s tweet about 'still rowin', leaves fans eager for his return.
memorableMoments: When Arya offers Gendry a place as her family, he affectionately responds, ‘You’d be m’Lady,’ highlighting their deepening bond.
His revelation of Robert Baratheon being his father by Melisandre intertwines his fate with the ongoing battle for power in Westeros.
Joe Dempsie’s playful tweet about Gendry's absence during Season 4 added a layer of humor to his mysterious disappearance, keeping fans engaged and hopeful for his return.

name: Qyburn
description: Starting as a disgraced and exiled former Maester, Qyburn rises to prominence by aligning himself with Cersei Lannister. Known for his unethical experiments and dark innovations, he plays a crucial role in the transformation of Ser Gregor Clegane into 'The Mountain' through questionable means. His expertise becomes instrumental in reviving wildfire as a weapon in King’s Landing, cementing his position as a key player in Cersei's court. Qyburn’s ascent to Hand of the Queen during Cersei’s coronation marks a significant rise from obscurity, highlighting his cunning ability to navigate and manipulate power dynamics within the Lannister regime.
memorableMoments: His blunt revelation to Jamie Lannister that his 'weakness' is curiosity underscores Qyburn's manipulative nature.
The official appointment as Hand of the Queen during Cersei’s coronation showcases his successful maneuvering into a position of immense influence and power.

name: Talisa Maegyr
description: Introduced as the compassionate and skilled healer in Robb Stark's camp, Talisa quickly becomes integral to his life. Their relationship develops into one of the rare heartfelt romances on Game of Thrones. Her role during the Red Wedding is especially poignant, marking her death as a significant emotional impact beyond what was depicted in George R.R. Martin’s books. Talisa represents Robb Stark's struggle between duty and personal desire, adding depth to his tragic end.
memorableMoments: Making an immediate impression on Robb by tending to an injured Lannister soldier showcases her compassion and skill as a healer.
Her suggestion to name their unborn child after Ned Stark if it were a boy highlights the deep bond she shares with the Stark family, even amidst political turmoil.

name: Alliser Thorne
description: As the gruff and authoritative master-at-arms of Castle Black, Alliser Thorne is known for his abrasive demeanor and critical view of Jon Snow. His constant scrutiny and criticism create tension among recruits, often undermining their morale. Despite being a formidable warrior during key battles like the Battle of Castle Black, Thorne’s antagonistic behavior makes him a challenging character to sympathize with. Following Jeor Mormont's death, he assumes command at the Wall in Season 4, further cementing his role as Jon Snow's adversary.
memorableMoments: The creation of Jon Snow's mocking nickname, 'Lord Snow,' highlights Thorne’s penchant for sarcasm and underlines the tension between him and Jon.
His temporary leadership of Castle Black after Jeor Mormont's death provides a glimpse into his capability as a commander, though it is often overshadowed by his abrasive personality.

name: Osha
description: Introduced in the Wolfswood during the series' opening season, Osha is one of the first glimpses viewers receive into the wildling culture. Her intelligence and loyalty quickly become evident, as she proves herself to be a steadfast ally to Bran and Rickon Stark, especially after Theon Greyjoy’s betrayal leads to chaos at Winterfell. Despite her initial portrayal as part of the feared 'other' beyond the Wall, Osha's character is nuanced, demonstrating both strength and compassion.
memorableMoments: Her refusal to address Theon as 'my lord' in Season 1 subtly highlights her insight into the precariousness of his claim.
Assisting Bran and Rickon’s escape by seducing Theon underscores her cunning and loyalty to those she cares about.
Her attempt to use similar tactics on Ramsay Bolton in Season 6 tragically ends differently, marking a poignant moment in her storyline.

name: Olly
description: Introduced as the young son of wildling hunters whose village is destroyed in retaliation, Olly's journey with the Night’s Watch is marked by his struggle to reconcile personal trauma with newfound loyalties. Under Jon Snow's mentorship, Olly transforms into a committed member of the Watch, yet his deep-seated animosity towards the wildlings ultimately leads him to betray Jon. His character arc reflects the series' exploration of identity and allegiance in a world divided by war.
memorableMoments: Olly’s introduction as a traumatized young boy provides a powerful foundation for his later development into a key figure within the Night’s Watch.
The gradual shift in his loyalty towards Jon Snow, fueled by growing tensions with the wildlings, sets the stage for his eventual betrayal.
His execution during Season 6 evokes complex emotions, highlighting the tragic consequences of his choices.

name: Lancel Lannister
description: Introduced as a seemingly loyal servant to House Lannister, Lancel Lannister’s character arc takes an unexpected turn when he converts to the faith of the Sparrows in Season 5. This transformation marks his evolution from a pawn manipulated by Cersei and Tyrion into a key player within the religious uprising that nearly topples King's Landing. His unwavering dedication to the High Sparrow underscores themes of redemption and ideological conviction, even as he remains entangled in family intrigue.
memorableMoments: Lancel plays a crucial role in the 'hunting accident' leading to King Robert Baratheon’s demise, showcasing his early involvement in Cersei's schemes.
After suffering under Tyrion’s wit and sarcasm throughout Season 2, his absence is felt until he reemerges as a zealous Sparrow supporter.
His confrontation with Cersei at the end of Season 6 demonstrates a potential shift in loyalty, though ultimately thwarted by Qyburn's interventions.

name: Maester Pycelle
description: Maester Pycelle's tenure at King's Landing spans several reigns, where his outward loyalty to the Lannisters masks his intricate involvement in the kingdom’s politics. Known for his seemingly frail demeanor, which was later revealed as a cunning disguise, Pycelle navigates the treacherous waters of court intrigue with a quiet acumen. However, his inability to adapt to the volatile dynamics between Tyrion and Cersei ultimately leads to his downfall, demonstrating the perils of underestimating one's enemies.
memorableMoments: In Season 1, it is subtly revealed that Pycelle’s frailty was a calculated facade intended to disarm suspicion.
His encounter with Tyrion, resulting in an involuntary beard trim and imprisonment, marks a significant decline in his influence at court.
Pycelle’s overt mockery of Qyburn highlights his fatal misjudgment, leading to his demise.

name: Mace Tyrell
description: As the head of House Tyrell, Mace Tyrell's leadership is often overshadowed by his mother, Olenna Tyrell, whose strategic acumen compensates for his own lackluster abilities. Known for his comedic timing, Mace provides much-needed levity amid the grim events of King’s Landing. His tenure highlights the delicate balance between familial support and individual capability in a world fraught with political intrigue.
memorableMoments: During Tyrion Lannister's trial in Season 4, Mace serves as one of the judges, visibly bewildered by the proceedings, adding to his comedic portrayal.
Sent to Braavos by Cersei, he unwittingly becomes Arya Stark's next target when accompanied by her nemesis, Meryn Trant.
Despite the growing tensions with House Lannister, Mace’s obliviousness leaves him unprepared for Cersei’s ultimate betrayal.

name: Maester Aemon
description: Introduced as a wise and compassionate figure at Castle Black, Maester Aemon's true lineage as the last surviving member of House Targaryen adds depth to his character. His presence serves as a bridge between Westeros' past glories and its uncertain future, offering guidance to Jon Snow amidst his personal conflicts of loyalty and identity. Aemon’s role is pivotal in several key events at the Wall, cementing his status as one of the most beloved characters on Game of Thrones.
memorableMoments: In a poignant revelation during Season 1, Maester Aemon discloses his Targaryen heritage to Jon Snow, influencing Jon's decision to remain with the Night’s Watch.
His decisive vote in favor of Jon for Lord Commander during Season 5 exemplifies his belief in Jon’s leadership capabilities.
As he lay dying, Aemon reflects on his brother Viserys, known as 'Egg,' a character from the beloved 'Dunk and Egg' novellas, adding layers to his storied past.

name: Craster
description: Craster is depicted as an unsettling and morally ambiguous character living beyond the Wall. His brutal lifestyle and contentious relationship with both his family and the Night's Watch underscore the harsh realities of life in such a desolate land. Despite his often antagonistic interactions, Craster’s existence serves to highlight the desperate measures taken by those tasked with guarding the realm from threats beyond human comprehension.
memorableMoments: Craster's uneasy hospitality towards the Night's Watch hints at his fear that his dark secrets might be exposed.
His ill-advised confrontation with the starving Wildlings in Season 3, fueled by intoxication, ultimately leads to his demise, illustrating his lack of foresight and vulnerability.

name: Mance Rayder
description: Known as 'King-Beyond-the-Wall,' Mance Rayder is a charismatic leader who unites the wildlings under his command. His defection from the Night's Watch and subsequent rise to power demonstrate both his strategic acumen and natural leadership qualities. Despite facing betrayal, Mance remains steadfast in his principles, earning him respect even among his adversaries.
memorableMoments: Mance forms a bond with Jon Snow due to their shared history as deserters from the Night’s Watch, highlighting themes of loyalty and redemption.
His dramatic end on Melisandre’s pyre marks a significant turning point in the battle between the wildlings and the forces of Westeros, showcasing his tragic heroism.

name: Balon Greyjoy
description: As the King of the Iron Islands, Balon Greyjoy is characterized by his stubbornness and flawed leadership. His inability to effectively govern leads to multiple rebellions, which threaten not only his reign but also the stability of Westeros. Despite these shortcomings, Balon's relationship with his daughter Yara stands out as a notable exception to his otherwise harsh demeanor.
memorableMoments: Upon Theon's return, Balon quickly reasserts his authority with hostility, revealing little paternal warmth.
In contrast to typical Ironborn sexism, Balon recognizes and supports Yara as his true heir, showcasing an unexpected side of his leadership.
His stoic reaction upon receiving Ramsay’s grisly message—Theon’s severed hand—underscores his ruthless nature.

name: Tommen Baratheon
description: Tommen Baratheon ascends to the throne after his older brother Joffrey's untimely demise. Initially portrayed as a more compassionate and malleable ruler, Tommen becomes increasingly influenced by the conflicting pressures from Cersei Lannister and the High Sparrow. This manipulation leads to tragic decisions that culminate in his downfall.
memorableMoments: In an early display of his vulnerability, Tommen narrowly escapes death when Cersei attempts to poison him during a rebellion.
The transition from Callum Wharry to Dean-Charles Chapman occurs as Tommen’s character grows more central and complex with the series’ progression.
Despite his regal status, Ser Pounce, Tommen's beloved cat, endears himself to fans and adds a touch of relatability to his storyline.

name: Viserys Targaryen
description: Viserys Targaryen, the last surviving member of House Targaryen after Robert's Rebellion, is marked by his bitter and vengeful demeanor. His inability to wield power with dignity leads him to make desperate decisions, including offering his sister Daenerys in marriage to secure an army from Khal Drogo. Viserys’ tragic flaws—his arrogance and insecurity—ultimately lead to his downfall.
memorableMoments: In a pivotal scene, Viserys trades Daenerys' freedom for Drogo's support, setting the stage for her rise.
His demise comes when Drogo executes him with molten gold after enduring his relentless demands and insults, marking one of the series’ early brutal turning points.

name: The Three-Eyed Raven
description: Initially introduced through Bran Stark's visions as an enigmatic raven, the character of the Three-Eyed Raven is later revealed to be a powerful being with vast knowledge and insight. He plays a crucial role in guiding Bran on his path to becoming the new Warden of the North and ultimately fulfilling a greater destiny.
memorableMoments: The Raven first appears in Bran's early visions as an otherworldly figure, symbolizing wisdom and mystery.
In Season 6, he imparts vital knowledge to Bran by showing him significant events from the past, providing depth to both character development and plot progression.

name: Eddison Edd Tollett "Dolorous"
description: A loyal and steadfast member of the Night's Watch, Eddison "Dolorous" Edd Tollett is renowned for his unwavering support to Jon Snow. Known for his dry wit and dark humor, Edd plays a crucial role in key events across seasons, proving himself as one of the most reliable characters on the show.
memorableMoments: Nicknamed "Dolorous Edd" by his brothers at the Night's Watch, he is celebrated for his unique sense of humor.
Amidst turmoil within the Night’s Watch, Edd remains loyal to Jon after others betray their commander, solidifying his role as a trusted ally.
At the conclusion of Season 6, Jon names Edd Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, recognizing his leadership and loyalty.

name: Obara Sand
description: Obara Sand, the eldest of the Sand Snakes, is driven by an intense desire for vengeance following her father Oberyn's death. While she inherits his formidable combat skills and fiery spirit, Obara lacks Oberyn’s charm and strategic wisdom. Her actions often reflect a ruthless pursuit of retribution, making her both feared and unpredictable.
memorableMoments: Named after her legendary father, the "Red Viper" Oberyn Martell, Obara embodies his thirst for vengeance.
In a chilling display of power, she kills an informant by burying him in sand, showcasing her merciless nature.
During Season 6, Obara tracks down her cousin Trystane’s ship and coldly executes him to claim control over Dorne with her sisters.

name: Pyat Pree
description: Pyat Pree is one of the first characters on "Game of Thrones" to demonstrate overt magical abilities, marking him as both intriguing and sinister. A powerful warlock from Qarth, Pyat can create limitless duplicates of himself, showcasing his formidable sorcery. Despite his dark capabilities, he ultimately meets a fiery demise at the hands of Daenerys's dragons, providing a memorable moment in the series.
memorableMoments: During his initial meeting with Daenerys, Pyat reveals his ability to conjure doubles of himself through his magical tricks.
He conspires with Xaro Xhoan Daxos to overthrow the leaders of Qarth and steal Daenerys's dragons. This betrayal leads to his downfall when he is incinerated by her dragons.

name: Wun Wun
description: Wun Wun, affectionately known as "Wun Wun" by Jon Snow's men in the Night's Watch, is believed to be the last of his kind. Despite his fearsome appearance and imposing size, he quickly proves himself an invaluable ally through his bravery and loyalty. His notable actions during key battles highlight his crucial role in pivotal moments throughout the series.
memorableMoments: Wun Wun demonstrates his formidable combat skills when he fights valiantly against the White Walkers at Hardhome.
He provides a dark yet humorous moment by crushing a rebellious Night's Watch member with ease upon arriving to retrieve Jon Snow's body.
During the Battle of the Bastards, Wun Wun heroically charges alone into Winterfell’s gates, providing Jon and his forces with the opening they desperately need.

name: The Waif
description: In the House of Black and White, The Waif serves as Arya Stark's formidable adversary, challenging her both physically and mentally. Known for her stoic demeanor and exceptional combat skills, she embodies the rigorous demands of becoming a Faceless Man. Her relentless antagonism towards Arya fuels one of the show’s most intense character dynamics, culminating in a climactic confrontation that resonates deeply with viewers.
memorableMoments: The Waif is infamous for her constant provocation and challenging combat sessions with Arya, pushing her to the brink.
Her ultimate demise at Arya's hands serves as one of the series' most gratifying moments, symbolizing Arya’s growth and determination.

name: Jeor Mormont
description: Known affectionately as "The Old Bear," Jeor Mormont is revered as a stalwart and honorable leader of the Night's Watch. His leadership is characterized by fairness, respect, and unwavering loyalty to those under his command. Despite his eventual betrayal at Craster's Keep, Mormont leaves an indelible mark through his mentorship and bravery, particularly in his support for Jon Snow and his valor during the wight attack on the Fist of the First Men.
memorableMoments: Jeor Mormont appoints Jon Snow as his personal steward, recognizing his potential and fostering his growth within the Night's Watch.
Despite advancing age, Mormont demonstrates his enduring combat prowess by fiercely battling the encroaching wights at the Fist of the First Men in Season 3.

name: Rickon Stark
description: As the youngest member of House Stark, Rickon Stark often receives less focus compared to his siblings but remains an important part of the narrative. Known for his wild and adventurous spirit, he symbolizes both innocence lost and resilience amidst turmoil. Although his time on "Game of Thrones" is brief, his journey from a carefree child at Winterfell to his tragic demise under Ramsay Bolton's cruelty evokes deep emotional responses.
memorableMoments: Rickon’s untamed nature becomes increasingly evident as the chaos surrounding his family escalates in the early seasons.
His unexpected return in Season 6 is tragically cut short, underscoring the brutal realities of the world he inhabits when he falls victim to Ramsay Bolton.

name: Selyse Baratheon
description: Queen Selyse Baratheon, initially portrayed as a somewhat peripheral character, evolves into a more formidable presence by the fifth season. Her complex relationship with her daughter Shireen and unwavering devotion to the Lord of Light underscore her tragic arc. Despite her cruel actions, including sanctioning Shireen's sacrifice and keeping stillborn sons preserved in jars, Selyse’s final act of suicide can be interpreted as an acknowledgment of her own moral failings.
memorableMoments: In Season 3, it is revealed that Queen Selyse harbored the macabre practice of preserving her stillborn sons’ bodies in jars within her chambers.
During Season 4, she witnesses Melisandre’s fiery execution of her brother, Stannis Baratheon's sibling, further cementing her descent into fanaticism.
Her storyline culminates with a harrowing decision to sacrifice Shireen to the Lord of Light, followed by her own death by hanging.

name: Meryn Trant
description: Meryn Trant, a member of the Kingsguard, is characterized by his blind loyalty and brutal enforcement of authority. As one of Cersei Lannister's favored knights, Trant epitomizes ruthless obedience, often resorting to violence against those who challenge him or the ruling order. His untimely death at the hands of Arya Stark in Season 5 marks a pivotal moment, symbolizing justice for his many transgressions.
memorableMoments: In one notable encounter, Trant confronts Syrio Forel with overwhelming force despite the latter being unarmed except for a wooden practice sword—a display of excessive aggression.
He further exhibits his loyalty to the crown by violently assaulting Sansa Stark under King Joffrey's orders.
His life is abruptly ended by Arya Stark in Season 5, an act that serves as poetic justice for his cruel actions.

name: Hot Pie
description: Hot Pie stands out in 'Game of Thrones' as one of its most endearing characters. Despite the harsh realities that surround him, he maintains his kindness and good-hearted nature. Renowned for his culinary skills, particularly his increasingly lifelike wolf-shaped breads, Hot Pie provides a sense of warmth and nostalgia to those who encounter him. His appearances, though brief, leave lasting impressions on both Arya Stark and Brienne of Tarth.
memorableMoments: Initially presenting himself as brave to Arya Stark until the threat of her blade, Needle, reveals his true timid nature, endearing him further with his honesty.
In Season 2, he finds himself hiding in the bushes when their group is ambushed while traveling north to the Wall.
Between Seasons 3 and 4, Hot Pie's baking prowess notably improves, as seen in his wolf-shaped loaves which he gifts Arya and later Brienne.

name: Ros
description: Introducing 'Game of Thrones' as one of the first characters in the pilot episode, Ros starts her journey seemingly in the background as a prostitute serving Tyrion Lannister. Her character quickly gains depth and significance over the course of three seasons, evolving into a key player with surprising resilience and intelligence. Despite not being part of George R.R. Martin's 'A Song of Ice and Fire' books, Ros captures the audience’s admiration through her ability to challenge formidable figures such as Theon Greyjoy and Littlefinger, culminating in her tragic yet impactful demise.
memorableMoments: Initially appearing in the very first episode, Ros's significance was not immediately apparent but would unfold dramatically.
In Season 2, she attempts to seduce King Joffrey, a tense moment that is challenging for many viewers due to its intensity and stakes.
Her death at Joffrey’s hands after being revealed as a spy for Varys by Littlefinger is both brutal and satisfyingly ironic given the king's own demise shortly thereafter.
